title: DataStax Presents: Max Melnick of Deliotte
description:
Max Melnick of Deloitte introduces Mission Graph, a self-service platform for threat analysis on massive datasets, and explains how technologies including Apache Cassandra and DataStax Enterprise were used to create the solution. From DataStax Developer Day, Washington DC, 10/11/2018


ABOUT DATASTAX ENTERPRISE 6
DataStax  powers  the  Right-Now  Enterprise  with  the  always-on,  distributed  cloud  database  built  on  Apache  Cassandra™  and designed for hybrid cloud. DataStax Enterprise 6 (DSE 6) includes industry-leading performance, self-driving operational simplicity, and robust analytics.

Learn more at http://www.datastax.com/products/datastax-enterprise and https://www.datastax.com/products/datastax-enterprise-6

CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastax?sub_confirmation=1 
Site: http://datastax.com 
Facebook: https://facebook.com/datastax 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastax | https://twitter.com/datastax-academy
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/datastax
http://feeds.feedburner.com/datastax 
https://github.com/datastax 

ABOUT DATASTAX ACADEMY
On the DataStax Academy YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, webinars and much more to help you learn and stay updated with the latest information on DataStax Enterprise©.  Create an account on https://academy.datastax.com to watch our free online courses, tutorials, and more.

transcript.text: so a little bit about me I am currently a engineering lead for developing one of the analytic products that we have at Deloitte that I'll go into a little bit more but as far as my background I grew up not far from here in Bethesda Maryland and then went to school also not too far at UVA I studied systems engineering and joined Deloitte I've been at Deloitte for nine years now and in that time I've worn a lot of different hats I've done everything from the traditional consulting through to the more technical side of things so I've done ops I've done data science I've done software engineering I'm a committer on tensorflow so my passion is really more around building analytic solutions for clients and so I identify more with the developer side okay awesome oh yeah so you're you're an engineer you're a developer not an accountant exactly I thought but I thought Deloitte was like all accounting in yeah it not so that's what every time you say oh I worked for Deloitte because everyone in this town asked the first question is where do you work course and every town and they're like oh so your accountant it's like no I'm not an accountant I'm actually part of the technology consulting practice and then specifically within that do analytic product development ok cool so there's a whole group that you're a part of and I want to I want to hear from you a little bit about I'm gonna give you the clicker because these are your slides okay let's pretend that that didn't just happen so all right so what kind of problems are you solving for your customers yeah what the use case that I want to highlight at a generic level is more around identifying high-risk actors or entities in a network so what what does that mean what is that a guy yeah bad guys so that can be a lot of different things some examples if you're in the financial services and just identifying fraud rings national security identifying terrorists supply chain is important for companies talked about before they need to identify potentially risky suppliers in their supply chain oh right okay gotcha okay so that's your problem space right yeah and so as far as in order to do that there are a lot of challenges that the either the business of the mission analysts have with identifying these high-risk bad actors okay and so I like to like what challenges I like to categorize them under two big buckets one is more the the data side so a lot of the challenges with the data and then the operational side and so I'm going to talk a little bit about the data side since you got data problems yeah we got data problems who does it from a data perspective weed analysts that are trying to identify these bad actors have the typical challenges that a lot of companies have around dealing with the scale of data dealing with the high velocity of data but add additional challenge from a data perspective is how do you connect a lot of different data sets together into one to create one network that they can analyze so not only do you have to connect a lot of different data sources but you also have to connect a lot of different data types right so if you're doing the financial services fraud detection you're probably looking among other things that people organizations transactions to name a few right so how do you how do you connect all that a join yeah exactly how and so that and that's part of it but then get even more challenging you talk about connecting things around that might not be strongly keyed so for example let's say I'm looking at airline data in Delta all my tickets show up as max Melnick but in American they might show up as max Jay Melnick and the analyst doesn't want to see two different people when they're doing the analysis they want to see the same person it's you it's all you exactly and so how do you say that max Melnick and max Jay Melnick are the same for the analyst so that they can analyze it in one cohesive picture so that's a little bit on the the data side okay the challenges then there's obviously the operational challenges right now a lot of analysts have to go back and forth with IT which takes a lot of time to actually get an answer IT struggles with how do I write the queries so that I can answer these questions in an efficient manner so I can because they're trying to get the answers back to the analyst as quick as possible and then also how do you do all this at scale and fast right so how do we identify bad actors more quickly and easily is the big problem okay so you're talking about being able to kind of turn around that knowledge that's coming from analysts and build it back into the system so then the next round can be automated and right exactly loading that loop that feedback loop yeah okay cool so how have you solve this problem what do you got so the those problems inspired us to create a product called mission graph and I'll go into a lot of detail on what it is but at a high level the way I like to explain it is it's a self-service platform that helps business and mission analysts really do the analysis where it requires you to create a comprehensive network that combines lots of different types of data at massive scale okay and if you can't explain it in this sentence then good yeah it's not worth explaining if you can't explain it in a sentence so that's good and I'm a pictures guy I think a lot of people are more visual so what what does that look like right I talked about the self-service aspect of it so I'll take the persona of the analyst first I'm gonna go through a few of the personas for the overall solution but that might be relevant to you all as well but from an analyst perspective again we wanted to create a self-service platform an interface so that don't have to go to IT all the time and wait for an answer I also don't want to have to connect all this data myself manually right whether it be in Visio or something there's a robot and so specifically what we have here just to set up the example little bit what are we looking at here is imagining at the indirect air carriers or cargo carriers and I want to identify where there might be high-risk cargo carriers okay and so I don't expect that you all can see this I'll talk through it but what we've done is create one comprehensive picture of the air carriers and identify certain risks from from them and allow the analyst to actually start with hey here there's some high-risk carriers and explore okay well why might they be high-risk so a lot of times in these use cases one of the entry points is they get some information about a particular entity right in this case it's let's say jet wire is a air carrier that they saw in some report is high risk it's like okay well tell me is it really high risk and let me look into it a little bit so there's a tip that indicates that you might want to look at someone in particular so now you're going in and looking at
